intro: Atropis embergeri, commonly known as the Emberger's atropis, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in savanna or woodland environments. The plant's ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
